- new workspace
- new Plug-in project, accept all defaults
- Prefs > Java > Compiler > Errors/Warnings > Code Style:
    set "Non-externalized..." to Warning
- copy contents of attached file to clipboard
- select source folder and paste
- Ctrl+A

This is an issue with a stale markers being sent to the problems view to be opened - likely they were removed in a build during this (I can't replicate but I can see what happened using code inspection).

Are you running with auto build on? 

Either way we have a couple of options

1) We abort the operation for stale markers (current behaviour)
2) We open the problems view with no selection
3) We see what we can figure out and try and select on afterwards

I think 2) makes the most sense as the marker is inconsistent and will likely be a mismatch anyways.

Looking at the code again I think it actually makes more sense to do 1) - we failed to open on the marker and so are returning false.

I have updated the core exception logging using the pattern prescibed by CoreException and I think that is all we want to do.

Verified in Version: 3.4.0
Build id: I20071212-0010
